verses.roman:
hena kṛṣṇādhara-sudhā, ye kaila amṛta mudhā,
yāra āśāya gopī dhare prāṇa
ei veṇu ayogya ati, sthāvara 'puruṣa-jāti',
sei sudhā sadā kare pāna

synonyms: hena—such; kṛṣṇa-adhara—of Kṛṣṇa's lips; sudhā—nectar; ye—which; kaila—made; amṛta—nectar; mudhā—surpassed; yāra āśāya—by hoping for which; gopī—the gopīs; dhare prāṇa—continue to live; ei veṇu—this flute; ayogya—unfit; ati—completely; sthāvara—dead; puruṣa-jāti—belonging to the male class; sei sudhā—that nectar; sadā—always; kare pāna—drinks.
translation: " 'This flute is utterly unfit because it is merely a dead bamboo stick. Moreover, it belongs to the male sex. Yet this flute is always drinking the nectar of Kṛṣṇa's lips, which surpasses nectarean sweetness of every description. Only in hope of that nectar do the gopīs continue to live.
